review_title: Good Place for Nurses and Health Care Professionals but not so good for other professions
job_title: Not Health Care Professional in Halifax, NS
pros:
If you were to gain trust of leadership and people you are working, it is a supportive environment generally with good team members. People do really care!
Nurses are provided with many resources and it is a great place to be a Nurse.
cons:
As a professional you have minimal resources as all the resource will be spent on Care.  
The unions are really strong and there are many people with variety of performance levels. Some employees end up working more to support those who really don't want to be there but protected by the "union" and technicalities.
Hospital can not make many productive changes to improve systems or processes, or if they do it is very slow. Change seems to be everywhere and makes you feel hopeful but it does not come fast enough. Most of the existing employees don't want change anyway, but improvement is essential. There is very limited professional or leadership  development for employees other then nurses and some health care professionals, as the resources are limited.

pros: People are great. They are friendly and awesome to work with.
cons: Not much career or growth opportunities

job_title: Biomedical Equipment Technician in Halifax, NS
pros: generally speaking most people were good to work with
cons: Not for the faint of heart in certain situations where you see families suffering

pros: Opportunities for career growth available.
cons: none that i can think of

pros: it was close to my home
cons: no place to career improvement

review_title: Short time as Project Manager at IWK
pros: Good benefits. Fair compensation. People were friendly, good organization-wide training.
cons: Bad timing for me: manager did not have time respond to emails, answer questions, or attend regular meetings. She was frequently away. Most employees were stressed out, and didn't have time to attend meetings. I was dismissed me after 7-weeks without warning (& without cause).

job_title: Clinical Applications Specialist in Halifax, NS
pros: Great company to work for. Great HR department, very helpful benefits, and payroll staff. Excellent resources as the funding for children's hospitals is usually better than adult hospitals. Nice building, great staff a place where everyone knows everyone. A teaching hospital so a lot of innovation.
cons: No cons that I can honestly think of. When I work for the IWK I felt like a valued employee.

review_title: Great people, friendly place, good cause.
pros: I loved working here, there were times where you really felt like you were making a difference. The workplace environment is very friendly and positive.
cons: There were so many people working here with so many things going on that at times you felt like your contributions were not always important.

pros: Working at a place that helps other people.
cons: Bad management, pure and simple with the 'new' leaders in place, and very bad treatment of many staff including nurses.   Note:  Anne McGuire is no longer the CEO.  She was amazing.  New CEO is not.

pros: Great people and purpose. Good pay.
cons: Managers and leaders are traditionally disconnected from their teams. The IWK is losing great talented people because of bad leaders.

pros: Great community and learning opportunities
cons: Poor staffing  and unsafe work conditions
